title: Update reference repos rebooting jenkins
body:
https://openj9-jenkins.osuosl.org/view/Infrastructure/job/Update-Reference-Repos is causing jenkins to reboot. It was running on Sunday so I moved it to Monday and weekend builds didn't have any issue. The build on Monday rebooted. https://openj9-jenkins.osuosl.org/view/Infrastructure/job/Update-Reference-Repos/227

One thing we can do is break it up to run on subsets of machines, probably by platform as we do for the cleaning jobs.

I also noticed the job is configured to load from https://github.com/adambrousseau/openj9.git serial_update_ref_job branch.

@AdamBrousseau

timeline_data.body:
Issue Number: 20346
Status: Open
Recommended Components: comp:build, comp:vm, comp:jclextensions
Recommended Assignees: adambrousseau, pshipton, llxia

performed_via_github_app.name: GitHub Actions
performed_via_github_app.description: Automate your workflow from idea to production

timeline_data.body: Updated the job to point at the main repo. Looks like I was testing a change that got merged and I never changed the config back.

Internally, we likely had this same issue because I divided up by platform. I've gone ahead and broken it up at OpenJ9 too. Here are the new jobs.
https://openj9-jenkins.osuosl.org/view/Infrastructure/job/Update-Reference-Repos/search/?q=Update-Reference-Repos-AIX
https://openj9-jenkins.osuosl.org/view/Infrastructure/job/Update-Reference-Repos/search/?q=Update-Reference-Repos-Mac
https://openj9-jenkins.osuosl.org/view/Infrastructure/job/Update-Reference-Repos/search/?q=Update-Reference-Repos-Windows
https://openj9-jenkins.osuosl.org/view/Infrastructure/job/Update-Reference-Repos/search/?q=Update-Reference-Repos-Linux-x86
https://openj9-jenkins.osuosl.org/view/Infrastructure/job/Update-Reference-Repos/search/?q=Update-Reference-Repos-Linux-s390x
https://openj9-jenkins.osuosl.org/view/Infrastructure/job/Update-Reference-Repos/search/?q=Update-Reference-Repos-Linux-aarch64
https://openj9-jenkins.osuosl.org/view/Infrastructure/job/Update-Reference-Repos/search/?q=Update-Reference-Repos-Linux-ppc64le

Issue Number: 20346
Status: Closed
Actual Components: comp:infra
Actual Assignees: No one :(
PR Assignees: No one :(

performed_via_github_app.name: GitHub Actions
performed_via_github_app.description: Automate your workflow from idea to production

timeline_data.body: Changed the times back to Sunday. Spread throughout the day.
I still think we should do it on Monday morning, often there is nothing going on at this time. I'll update the jobs.

Seems it's either xLinux or Windows causing the reboot. I started both of these and a reboot happened.
https://openj9-jenkins.osuosl.org/view/Infrastructure/job/Update-Reference-Repos-Linux-x86/1/
https://openj9-jenkins.osuosl.org/view/Infrastructure/job/Update-Reference-Repos-Windows/1
I'm going to disable both of these for now and we can experiment later.
Ok. I was reading about git gc again. Seems it may not be required on newer versions of git. But it will take some experimentation to determine if we can remove it. Related #20350.

Nothing is running on jenkins atm. Started xlinux update to see if it causes a reboot.
https://openj9-jenkins.osuosl.org/view/Infrastructure/job/Update-Reference-Repos-Linux-x86/5/

Rerun without git gc
https://openj9-jenkins.osuosl.org/view/Infrastructure/job/Update-Reference-Repos-Linux-x86/6/
https://github.com/eclipse-openj9/openj9/commit/d0d6d348b5ac9228e0d8468c1abe9a8aaae1f242

Looks like we've been running 390 sucessfully
https://openj9-jenkins.osuosl.org/job/Update-Reference-Repos-Linux-s390x/

Ah right, I'm pretty sure it's git gc running on the master that is causing it to fall over.

Laptop test with fresh cache
```
adam:git_cache$ git remote -v
jdk	git@github.com:ibmruntimes/openj9-openjdk-jdk.git (fetch)
jdk	git@github.com:ibmruntimes/openj9-openjdk-jdk.git (push)
jdk11	git@github.com:ibmruntimes/openj9-openjdk-jdk11.git (fetch)
jdk11	git@github.com:ibmruntimes/openj9-openjdk-jdk11.git (push)
jdk17	git@github.com:ibmruntimes/openj9-openjdk-jdk17.git (fetch)
jdk17	git@github.com:ibmruntimes/openj9-openjdk-jdk17.git (push)
jdk21	git@github.com:ibmruntimes/openj9-openjdk-jdk21.git (fetch)
jdk21	git@github.com:ibmruntimes/openj9-openjdk-jdk21.git (push)
jdk23	git@github.com:ibmruntimes/openj9-openjdk-jdk23.git (fetch)
jdk23	git@github.com:ibmruntimes/openj9-openjdk-jdk23.git (push)
jdk8	git@github.com:ibmruntimes/openj9-openjdk-jdk8.git (fetch)
jdk8	git@github.com:ibmruntimes/openj9-openjdk-jdk8.git (push)
omr	git@github.com:eclipse-omr/omr.git (fetch)
omr	git@github.com:eclipse-omr/omr.git (push)
openj9	git@github.com:eclipse-openj9/openj9.git (fetch)
openj9	git@github.com:eclipse-openj9/openj9.git (push)
```
```
adam:git_cache$ du -shc *
4.0K	config
4.0K	description
388K	FETCH_HEAD
4.0K	HEAD
64K	hooks
4.0K	info
2.7G	objects
14M	refs
2.7G	total
```
```
adam:git_cache$ time git gc --aggressive --prune=all
Enumerating objects: 2104080, done.
Counting objects: 100% (2104080/2104080), done.
Delta compression using up to 22 threads
Compressing objects: 100% (1963247/1963247), done.
Writing objects: 100% (2104080/2104080), done.
Selecting bitmap commits: 243042, done.
Building bitmaps: 100% (353/353), done.
Total 2104080 (delta 1527280), reused 453047 (delta 0), pack-reused 0 (from 0)
Expanding reachable commits in commit graph: 244319, done.

real	6m11.738s
user	34m24.057s
sys	0m12.361s
```
```
adam:git_cache$ du -shc *
4.0K	config
4.0K	description
388K	FETCH_HEAD
4.0K	HEAD
64K	hooks
364K	info
580M	objects
308K	packed-refs
0	refs
581M	total
```
While it does significantly shrink the size, I'm not sure the 2GB savings on disk is worth the headaches if gc is proved to be the cause of the issues.
We may not have room for an extra 2GB on some of the xlinux machines. I think they are already tight due to the docker images.
That is true. Hopefully that is resolved by infra issue 10241

Update job passed when I removed git gc. Next test is to run it with gc but not on master.
Removed `worker` label from built-in.

https://github.com/eclipse-openj9/openj9/commit/1e1a19dee1846599b2ae02db1f0bbf61d01d8f64
https://openj9-jenkins.osuosl.org/view/Infrastructure/job/Update-Reference-Repos-Linux-x86/9/
9 looks good. I'm happy to not run anything on master and disable gc on aix since it seems to be a problem? Once those code changes are in we can re-enable the jobs. What do you think?

issue.title: Skip git gc on aix and master/built-in

repository.name: openj9
repository.description: Eclipse OpenJ9: A Java Virtual Machine for OpenJDK that's optimized for small footprint, fast start-up, and high throughput.   Builds on Eclipse OMR (https://github.com/eclipse/omr) and combines with the Extensions for OpenJDK for OpenJ9 repo.

timeline_data.body:
PR is merged. Jobs re-enabled. 
Windows doesn't have much history so I launched one to see what happens.
https://openj9-jenkins.osuosl.org/job/Update-Reference-Repos-Windows/2/
Timed out after 6 hours. Not sure if most machines were still in gc or just one.
rerun
https://openj9-jenkins.osuosl.org/job/Update-Reference-Repos-Windows/3/
